briefTitle: Study of DU-176b Aged 80 Years or Older
officialTitle: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Parallel-group, Multicenter Study of DU-176b in Patients With NVAF Aged 80 Years or Older Who Are Ineligible for Available Oral Anticoagulation Therapy
summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of edoxaban in patients with non-valvular NVAF aged 80 years or older who are ineligible for available oral anticoagulation therapy.

primaryOutcome.measure: Number of Participants With a Composite Endpoint of Stroke and Systemic Embolic Events (SEE) in Participants Who Were Administered DU-176b Compared With Placebo
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Randomization up to the time of onset of the initial composite event of stroke or systemic embolic event, or study discontinuation, or end of study (whichever comes first), up to 3 years 2 months postdose (maximum follow-up time)
